reviews.title: a great place and affordable place
reviews.text: Of the many budget hotels that I've stayed, this was a terrific one. Clean, comfortable, and very pleasant staff. Outstanding location (right on one of the canals), and a great coffee and bagel shop around the corner. The bed was surprisingly comfortable, with down cover and comforter.

reviews.title: The Great Hotel Eureka
reviews.text: An A+ experience....I'd recommend it to anyone.

reviews.title: charm and character
reviews.text: The Hotel Eureka was perfect for our stay in Amsterdam in every way. The location, friendly staff, and comfortable accommodations exceded my expectations. The hotel is located in the heart of the city along the Amstel, and being an old canal house, staying there was an experience in itself. Almost every major tourist attraction along with numerous restaurants and shops were within easy walking distance. For those that were not, we simply walked a block to the Muntplein station and caught the tram. Being so close to everything really helped cut expenses and made it convenient to stop by the hotel throughout the day to drop off bags or grab something from the room. The staff was extremely warm and friendly, including Moreno the cat who roams freely throughout the hotel. We were offered coffee and pie in the reception area upon checkin, and were also given plenty of tourist materials, maps, and information pamplets. On several occasions, the receptionists helped us with directions and made personal recommendations of things to do and see while in the city. The room was beautifuly decorated and most importantly clean. House keeping was convenient and thorough. No early morning knock at the door! The view of the city and canal just outside our window was breathtaking. The breakfast offered each morning is definately a must. Offering a wide array of food choices, it was both convenient and delicious. I reccommend this hotel full heartedly to anyone seeking an authentic and comfortable stay in Amsterdam.

reviews.title: An EXCELLENT choice, good value for money
reviews.text: my girlfriend and i are just back from hotel eureka and had a wonderfull time. we have been coming to amsterdam for a number of years now and have stayed at a number of hotels, some good, some bad and some downright ugly. i thought our stay at hotel eureka was our best yet. don't get me wrong, there are more "upmarket" hotels around, but many of those are the same no matter where you go, and after all amdsterdam isn't about glitz but old world charm. Hotel Eureka has that in abundance. the rooms have a fantastic view across the amstel, with upper floors having balconies. the windows open right out too which would be fantastic in summer. breakfast was good the two times we had it and all the staff where friendly. The location is perfect. turn right and you amble towards the red light district in about 2 minutes. dam square and the leidseplein are also within comfortable walking distance although there are trams if you are feeling lazy. i would also recommend perhaps turning left from the hotel once or twice which will lead you to a local market and the student district which has some nice cafes and shops we had never seen before. overall i really can't fault the hotel. the only thing i would add is that there is a dog and a cat within the hotel so to watch out for any allergies

reviews.title: A stay in heaven!
reviews.text: Sometimes everything falls together: a great location in a very nice area with a lot of restaurants and pubs, a cosy room with a beautiful view and an extreme friendly and helpful staff. I am sure my wife and I will come back in Hotel Eureka!!

We've stayed at The Eureka Hotel once which was fine however they also rent Houseboats and Apartments which are amazing! Walking around Amsterdam really takes it out of you and putting your feet up in a houseboat on a canal right in the middle of town is the best possible antidote to tired legs. While the less informed rest, bored in their small windowless hotel you can be watching (and in most cases waving to) other boats that pass up and down the canals, smoking some of Amsterdam's finest and relaxing. We love this place and over the years have stayed in two different apartments and five different houseboats (all only a five minute walk to everything you need) as well as the hotel which have all been good. I would suggest the brown colored boat (with the red door) opposite the hotel is the best, but all the boats are amazing and are centrally heated which is important in Amsterdam in the winter. People expecting 5 star luxury should be warned there's a few dusty corners and all the cutlery wont match but if you can get over that you'll have the time of your life.
reviews.title: Amsterdam's best kept secret

likes.liked: — It's a boat, on a canal, in Amsterdam do i need to say more

reviews.text: We spent two days in Amsterdam recently as part of our honeymoon and were very pleased with the Eureka. I was not expecting great things, having read some of the other reviews, but was pleasantly surprised by the warm reception, great location and perfectly liveable room. We had a room at the back, with no view, but still had a great time. The bathroom was fine, the bed was very soft, but I had a great sleep, and the room was in shabby but clean shape. We had access to the internet for free, which is a rare privilege in Europe. The breakfast was delicious and we opted to pay for it on the second day because of the range of choices and reasonable price. Will, who seems to run things, was so welcoming and friendly, offered us second coffees without being asked, and we felt right at home.
reviews.title: Great time at the Eureka

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the actual address is difficult to find on a map, (our cabby had to use his GPS to find it) it is right across a bridge from Rembrandtsplein and we were able to walk everywhere we needed from the hotel. We loved the friendly, relaxed attitude of the Dutch people and fell in love with the city itself.
reviews.title: Budget Hotel---Loved the breakfast

reviews.text: The walls are very thin, that was the only downside...
reviews.title: Excellent Location... That Doesn't Match The Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, while it is not a Best Western, it was a great choice for us and we highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Do Not Book Standard Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I travel at least 5 times a yr all over the world and I have to say this is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Avoid This Hotel
Great Location
reviews.text: We were given room 15 on the back of the hotel it was very small, there was a small window which looked out onto a brick wall, it was very old fashioned with red shag pile carpet which looked like it had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: been down for years, stains on the walls,and the bed and linen were DAMP. The bathroom was a disgrace with mould all over the tiles and NO COLD RUNNING WATER.,
reviews.title: Top location, Great Value...

reviews.text: We tried to change the room but there was only one room available for
reviews.title: Very Pleasant

likes.disliked: — Although Canal Side couldn't quite see canal cause below street level

reviews.text: an extra 40 euro's which we were happy to pay but the room they were offering was even smaller with two single beds which lay head to head along one wall. They wouldn't give us a refund so we could stay elsewhere so we were stuck with the room.
reviews.title: Amazing Apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Eureka Hotel from 12th April to 16th April 2008. Was early checking in but could leave bags while we wandered about the city until our room was ready. Checkin was quick and efficient. Stayed in room 42 on top floor,lovely view of canal. Room was clean and comfortable, bathroom was fine.Plenty of hot water whenever we needed it. Bed was very comfortable, and rooms were cleaned daily. Found the staff to be very polite and helpful. Loved the breakfast, incredible value for €10 per person, although first mornings breakfast is free!! Hotel is very centrally located but far enough from Rembrandtplein that you're not disturbed by noise in the night time.Would definately stay there again and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone. We will be back!!
reviews.title: "Perfect!!!"

likes.disliked: — There wasn't anything that we didn't like.

reviews.text: Small rooms but that was the only downside.We were made so welcome by Willi and his team that we felt that we were staying with friends in their houseThe breakfasts were very good and tea or coffee was available at all times.What with an excellent location thrown in it was a memorable 5 days.
reviews.title: Friendliest Hotel we've ever stayed in

reviews.text: I have very mixed feelings about this place.
reviews.title: Mixed opinions

likes.liked: — The helpful staff and the charming lounge/breakfast room
likes.disliked: — The slightly shabby, run down feel on the accommodation floors above reception

reviews.text: I should first of all say that I stayed in the hotel (as I have several times before) and have never stayed in the apartments which, unlike the hotel, seem to get consistently bad reviews.
reviews.title: Not bad if you like dirty accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is conveniently located between the Museum areas and the central station. Probably about a 10 or 15 minute walk, if you take the most direct route, between the two. The hotel is on a nice quiet little street and the front of the hotel is attractive.
reviews.title: Great value hotel!

likes.disliked: — hot water went off one day for a few hours

reviews.text: Three of us stayed here in June (peak season) after recommendations from the tripadvisor website and whilst the rooms were tiny, the staff more than made up for it by being so friendly and helpful. We were offered a beer on arrival (free!) and the 10 euro breakfast was sensational - very good value for money. Not your usual continental breakfast (jam, croissants, etc) but a proper cooked breakfast. It was close to everything and we were able to get around easily. I would highly recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Warm and accommodating

reviews.text: the dutch have a word for it - 'gezellige',meaning charm,cosiness,friendliness and a place that puts you at ease right away. we stayed at the amsterdam hotel eureka for a week,14-21 june.i have stayed in stiffer,more formal and more expensive hotels,but nowhere with more real charm and easy friendliness. the room we had was no.22,with two huge windows and a handy pair of armchairs,were you can chill and watch the boats on the canal,the moorhens,the swans,and every morning,a grey heron which posed like a supermodel on the roof of the houseboat in front of us.there's also a massive and extremely comfortable bed and clean wc and showerroom ensuite,and lovely crisp cotton sheets each day. the area around the hotel is great- there are very comfortable,relaxed bars and cafes about 3 mins walk round the corner,it takes 12 mins to newmarket square and the zeedijk,5 mins to rembrandt's house,5 to rembrandt square (great for people-watching)5 to the flower market,15 mins walk to the rijksmuseum and the van gogh (but tram stops are only 2 mins away also).yet although the hotel is close to so much life,it is an oasis of calm and serenity. the house cat is a honey,and the staff here are just lovely. breakfast was magnificent - i had smoked salmon every morning! and you can eat as much as you like of a great array of salmon,ham,cheese (good cheese)yoghurt,juices,fruit and coffees,herb teas and tea.
reviews.title: gezellige (dutch for cosy) eureka hotel

reviews.text: anyone who likes to feel their stay in their hotel is an effortless,informal and relaxed experience will love the hotel eureka- i did.
reviews.title: Incredible houseboats and apartments
charming and laid back but won't suit petphobes
reviews.text: Having stayed on Amsterdam Houses houseboats and in their apartments I can only say WOW! The best location in Amsterdam!!!!! Incredibly glamourous staff!!!! Do yourself a favour if you want to stay in the most incredible city on the planet---make your reservations now for accomodations that are out of this world!

went there for 5 nights, 4 of us. we got thereabout 12, we thought too early to check in, but one room was ready and we were welcome to leave our bags there. we were givben a 'welcome' drink by the manager. the rooms were small but charming - they go in a lot for wall-mirrors in this place! would not suit the very large/americans as there was just a bed, wardrobe, a stool, chair and table and absolutely no room for anything else! we booked late, so had a view of a sort of courtyard only, recommend book early for canal views, or houseboats. the bathrooms were also small, a shower, toilet and basin, but with a hairdryer and shower gel/shampoo, soap, cap, polish etc. easy use taps round pin plugs, but converters and apparently everything you can think of available at reception. tea and coffee making facilities you can smoke in the rooms but they do request you leave the window a little open. I didnt get the impression that they particularly wanted the other sort of smoking, but were like everyone else we met, very toleran.
reviews.title: Quaint ,value for money,bolt hole

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner and staff speak English and are extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel is situated only a few minutes walk from the Red Light District, the Museums and the markets. The hotel is an older historic building located directly on a canal, but it is clean and well-maintained. We would use this hotel again!
reviews.title: Friendly Staff, Great Location

likes.liked: — Staff and Owner were very helpful and friendly
likes.disliked: — Parking is difficult in Amsterdam, but that is everywhere!

reviews.title: Two nights at this great little hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this great little hotel for 2 nights, mid July 2006. We wish that we could have stayed longer.... so we are already planning to return as soon as we can !

reviews.title: Great location, average rooms
reviews.text: We totally agree with the positive sentiments expressed by previous guests via this site.
The staff were certainly very friendly and helpful. The shower room was clean, the bedroom was clean and comfortable with great views over the Amstel canal.
reviews.title: A home from home

reviews.text: Being able to enjoy the substantial, buffet-style breakfasts up until noon was a bonus.
reviews.title: Walking distance to alot, but there's better around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our arrival at the hotel we were treated in a very friendly manner, given a load of sight seeing maps and brochures, and a general rundown of where all the sights and shopping centres were, which we found to be most helpful. The hotel itself although small was clean and served a lovely breakfast (buffet), it also had on line facilities and library with daily newspapers. A few minutes walk took us to rembrandt plein where a large choice of restaurants were to be found, also the shops on rokin and kalverstraat are nearby, making the hotel very central but not noisey.
reviews.title: friendly and clean

likes.liked: — clean and bright with all facilities

reviews.text: We had a great 5 days in Amsterdam made more enjoyable by the hotel staff who went out their way to make our stay as carefree and pleasant as possible.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A big thankyou to all at the hotel for giving us a fine experience of Holland and Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Charming, great vibe
A really lovely WELCOME
reviews.text: Loved every minute of our stay at Amsterdam House! Okay, it doesn't have walk in closets or American size bathrooms, but remember, it was built in the 1600's!! If you want personal attention, a lovely breakfast room, and the perfect central location, this is the hotel for you. There is a charming outside sitting area where you can watch the boats go by, not to mention Moreno, the hotel cat, chasing the resident heron who shows up daily for cheese. Walk across the bridge and you're at Rembrandtplein and can hop on a city tram or take a canal cruise. Walk a few blocks in the other direction and you can visit Rembrandt's House. If you want the flavor of Amsterdam, stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a lift so don't worry about the narrow stairs and the hotel staff will book tours. All the staff was lovely and memorable. Thank you for everything. Vickie & Joani (Calif. & Ill.)
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed there with my fiance and we just loved it!! The location is great, where you can go waking to almost everywhere. Choose a room with a view of the canal amstel. The decoration is lovely, the breakfast delicious and the reception very kind. The room was a bit small, but very good and the bed had a good size (double). Very close to a good restaurant (like 50 steps!) and a market where you can have for lunch a lot of thing and for a good price.
reviews.title: Like a dream!!

reviews.text: We rented a well-equipped flat in the center of Amsterdam through this hotel. Initially there were some problems with the booking because they first confirmed another accomodation which later was not available. However, in the end they turned out to be fair on costs.
reviews.title: Beautiful Flat for 8 persons rented

likes.disliked: — Have breakfast in the Bagels&Beans below.

reviews.text: We stayed for one night in November 2006 and found this hotel to be ideal.It is a ten minute walk from the central station and just out of the way of the centre but close enough on foot ( 5 mins tom Dam square,ten minutes to the red light district) The rooms were small and basic but very clean and with its own toilet/shower suite. The staff (Will especially) were really helpful and friendly and could not do enough to make our stay as good as they could. The breakfast was ample and it was great to be able to cook our own omelettes on the hotplate!!! Overall i would highly recommend this place as we had a disastrous night the night before at the Hotel Hortus (do not stay there at all it is awful!) and this was an absolute pleasure to stay in after that.We would most certainly go back.
reviews.title: A little gem of a place!

likes.liked: — Reception was good,friendll staff,great breakfast and good lochttp://gin.tripadvisor.com/UserReviewToolation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Amsterdam, and we chose the Hotel Eureka based on generally favourable Tripadvisor reviews. We were not disapointed. Arriving mid-morning following an early start from home we were treated to a comlimentary coffee and slice of apple pie in the lounge (these personal touches mean a lot and this was typical of our stay). We had asked for a double room but there was only a twin available and although the receptionist offered to change us the following day we decided to keep it for our 3 night stay. The room was "unusual" being long and narrow with the single beds end to end rather than side by side. The decor was also a bit "tired" and the furniture is best described as inexpensive antique. However, it was clean with enough space, had lots of character and a lovely view over the Amstel River. We also had fresh flowers on the coffee table the day after our arrival. Although Breakfast was not included in the price, the first mornings was complimentary and was good enough for us to pay 10 Euros each for the following days. The hotel lounge/breakfast room had a cosy feel to it and we enjoyed a relaxing complimentary drink there each evening before retiring.
reviews.title: Friendliest Hotel in Amsterdam?
I'm Homesick
reviews.text: The location is great for exploring the centre of Amsterdam. In the heart of the Old Town but not near the Red Light District. The nearest tram stop was only a few minutes walk away so access to and from the station was no problem.
